channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MA

item.title: Report X-2025050274
item.description:
Report X-2025050274

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-02T15:18:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-18
  • City: LYNNFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO OF DELAWARE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DRIVER INFORMED EMPLOYEE THAT A PRELOAD SUPIVISOR TOLD HIM THERE WAS A LEAKING PACKAGE IN HIS TRUCK THEN PROCEEDED TO MOVE THE LEAKING PACKAGE FROM THE SHELVE TO THE FLOOR. THE DRIVER THEN NOTICED THE PACKAGE AT THE END OF THE ROUTE LEAKING ON THE FLOOR AND ON THE SHELF. DRIVER THEN ARRIVED IN THE BUILDING AND CALLED A SUPIVISOR TO GET HE DMP TO CLEAN UP THE TRUCK AND PROCESS THE LEAKER.THE PACKAGE HAD A STRONG ODOR TO IT AND AFTER OPENING THE BOX TO SEE UN 1263 DIAMOND LABELS ON THE CANS OF PAINT

item.title: Report X-2025050191
item.description:
Report X-2025050191

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-01T01:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-28
  • City: WEST BRIDGEWATER
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: William Shea, Operations Supervisor, called safety to report a spill in trailer 401238 of UN1133, ADHESIVES, 3, PG II. William stated that while unloading the trailer, a 5-gallon pail was found with the lid peeled back, which he suspects was done by a forklift while being loaded at a different facil ity. William stated that approximately 16 ounces of the adhesive spilled on the trailer floor and on the skid could be a different substance than what is in the pale with the damaged top. He mentioned that they pulled the skid out of the trailer and placed it on cardboard on the dock floor to get a better look at the damaged pail. William believes the spill occurred due to an accident at another facility and spilled during transit.~~William stated that he would shut down the trailer and wait for the cleaning crew to assist in cleaning the skid, the trailer, and removing the pail in a recovery drum. Safety advised William of the ABF Safety Disposal's email.~

  • Description: CONTAINER WAS TRAVELING ON BULK BELT WITH LIQUID RUNNING DOWN THE SIDE OF CONTAINER. FIRST RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE LEAKING CONTAINER.RESPONDING WITH ALL PROPER PPE 7 REFRENCING THE DECISION TREE THE ITEM WAS BROUGHT BACK TO THE RESPONDER CAGE FOR PROCESSING
